summary: Peter, Paul, and Mary were a popular American folk music group formed in 1961 in New York City. The trio consisted of Peter Yarrow, Paul Stookey, and Mary Travers. They sang songs written by Yarrow and Stookey, as well as songs by Bob Dylan and other folk musicians. Their debut album was a big hit. After Mary Travers died in 2009, Yarrow and Stookey continued performing as a duo. The group was influenced by artists like Woody Guthrie and Pete Seeger, and they were known for their social commentary through music. They were inducted into the Vocal Group Hall of Fame in 1999.
title: Peter, Paul and Mary
